dialogues.text: Who're these guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too late. Take a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shines his light under the table, where the towers hav been detached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in here worth taking, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo hurries away from the Day Care. He has just one data tower, now, so he can move faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy starts to push past Shrot --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must be out there still --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets to the front room, where the jettisoned data towe still sits (but he doesn't see it).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling after) Forget about it. His car's not in  the lot, he's gone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shrot watches anxiously to see if he's stopped Randy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo moves low among the high-priced cars, lugging the to He gets to his Deux Chevaux, opens the trunk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo turns. It's Desi, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna get a cheeseburger or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As calmly as possible, he stows the tower, slams the trun gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Shrot & Len) Fellas, I'm gonna have to ask you to  leave here now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. I'm the one who found  out he was mucking around in here in  the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all grateful for that. Really.  Go out the way you came in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reluctantly, Shrot & Len head out toward the front ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo is on the phone, he drives as fast as one can in his car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me at the other location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you're not calling on your  car phone?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, Riman & Gunther have turned the Day Care into surveillance post. They hear Milo & Lisa's conversati speakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know, I had no choice. Get out  of the house now! Do you have a  laptop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's three years old, it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it to the other location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you said the other --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rings off. He reads something off a business card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scrambling, Lisa grabs her old laptop, finds her keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, alright. (hangs up, briefs  Gary) He's off campus, he's taken some  surveillance data with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary's eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's bringing her laptop, it's wired.  Second she boots up, we're on 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo reads the address off the business card, which has a satellite dish as its logo. (He holds it in front of him. When he brings down the card, it reveals a real-life sate dish through the windshield. As the car pulls up by a low cinderblock building, we rea sign that says KNQR - PUBLIC ACCESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo rushes in, lugging the tower. There's a linoleum flo framed one-sheets for tacky public access shows (Yoga, bl dried Evangelist, Nude Talk Show). Behind the reception d sits a beefy RENT-A-GUARD with an earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian here? Brian Bissel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up the phone) Who wants to see him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa drives fast, checking her rear-view-mirror to make s she's not being followed. Pan to the seat next to her: he laptop lies on the passenger seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A monitor shows a green interface with yellow coordinates (like an air traffic controllers' screen). Randy sits at keyboard in front of it, phone cradled on shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Nothing. They haven't booted-up yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo speaks to Brian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the biggest Beta demo in  like the history of software. You'd  be my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't pre-empt Yoga, that's our  biggest show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian! You wanna be a big deal, don't  you? That's your dream in life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian is examining the data tower. He touches the Outpost logo branded into it, rather reverently. Lisa comes in, laptop slung over her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will I get to work for Outpost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But you can write your own ticket  in the Valley after this. We're gonna  bring down Outpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they ever do for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian's thinking it over. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Great! We need to drag a lot  of heavy stuff in front of the door --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Rent-a-Guard) Wanna be a part of history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (digging in his pocket) Well -- would you like to pick up an  extra -- 232 dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary is pacing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Nothing yet, Gary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rent-a-Guard drags a file cabinet in front of the doo where he has already dragged the couch, some chairs, a ga can, two lamps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three TV's of various sizes and wood veneers are turned o one to NBC ("ER") one to CBS ("48 Hours") one to ABC  (toothpaste commercial). On an in-house monitor a leather Woman in a leotard does yoga. Lisa is cabling her laptop into the station's computer. B boots it up: it runs the satellite. Milo cables the data  tower into the laptop. Cables go in every which direction: the whole set-up has distinctly gerry-rigged look. Go tight on the laptop power switch. Lisa toggles it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yellow coordinates start blinking on. Randy sits at a console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) We've got a fix on 'em. (typing) 218 North Jericho Road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman grab holstered guns, race out. Randy ty some more, speaks into the phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Public access TV station. KNQR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil hangs up, blows a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's taken it to the public access  station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil sags gratefully into a chair... only to see Gary plo past him. At his workstation Gary types, mutters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he was doing in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bosch wall screen fills up with a dark blue backgroun longitude and latitude lines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary throws a printed spiral notebook at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me change the Skywire settings.  Add five degrees to each satellite  coordinate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary, don't worry, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do what I'm asking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary hits a switch. A wood panel slides into the wall,  revealing a bank of four TV's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman speed toward the station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo slips his disk in the laptop. Lisa cables the video  tower to the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're interfaced with our dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lisa) Gimme the coordinates?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa reads from Milo's little pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longitude 77 degrees, 03 minutes, 58  seconds East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo types on the laptop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latitude 38 degrees, 55 minutes, 14  seconds South.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phil reads to Gary as he types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 19 seconds South. Altitude 431 Miles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the Earth far below. The Skywire Satellite orbits  majestically into frame, shifts five degrees to the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo hits enter. Milo, Lisa, Brian, shift their collectiv gaze to the three funky TV sets. "ER" plays, uninterrupted, Dan Rather, Diane Sawyer on AB the Yoga lady, the audio of all four blending in a chaoti low melange that adds to the tension (particularly the fr medical emergency on "ER").

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your software?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it your dish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's the satellite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he thinks) Let's try #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, #2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longitude 48 degrees 06 minutes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman squeal into the station parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks out the window to the parking lot, below. Milo typing in coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're already here. My laptop must  be wired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxiously) Milo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (typing) We're there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo hits enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary hits enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second Skywire satellite shifts regally away from the E as if shunning the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo, Lisa, Brian watch the TV's. "ER" et al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman tear through the barricade the Rent-A-C has erected with ruthless precision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo cogitates while Lisa reviews the satellite coordinat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) You checked your connections?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Milo) Yes! Should you reboot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo is scrolling the software, trying to figure out whic of a 1,000 possible glitches is getting in the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been altering the coordinates  since we logged on. He's a step ahead.  Let's jump to #12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready for number three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longitude 109 --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Knows I'm altering the coordinates.  Let's jump to #12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rent-A-Guard drags furniture, props, lights, in front the entrance to the satellite room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman have created an opening in the barricad They step through it. They hear the racket the Rent-a-Gua is making upstairs. They head that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rent-A-Guard is holding a lightstand as they ascend,  guns drawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aside. We won't hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riman takes the lightstand from him. The Rent-a-Guard put his hands up, sidles across the hallway as they tear into the barricade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa reads to Milo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Latitude 47 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second. He knows I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's working backwards, too. (to Lisa) Let's do number five?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Longitude 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther and Riman rip down the barricade, reach the door. They whip it open, guns drawn. They see: An empty supply room. [The barricade was a decoy.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rent-A-Guard has joined Milo et al in here. He tries slide a heavy shelf in front of the door, but it's not ye in place. Lisa has dialed 911. She's scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now. They've got guns!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OS, we can hear Gunther and Riman pounding at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the door, Milo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Milo) You there yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (typing) One more second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits enter. The door is kicked open. Gunther & Rim Gunther with a gun, Riman still carrying the light stand. He immediately bashes the KNQR computer with it. Lisa loo devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, relax, relax!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds up the computer cable, to show Riman it was neve plugged in, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gunther) Should I call Phil? Or do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther knits his brow. He notices Milo: still staring at the TV screens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo? Wake up. Our regular programming  will not be preempted tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo's gaze stays fixed to the screens. Riman grabs him b the shirt. But Gunther's concerned by Milo's behavior:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at Milo) Wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Milo watches the screens, a pixilated, ghostly image b to appear on all of them: the animated Skywire logo (ligh strike, etc.). Brian lurches across to the laptop, ejects the CD-ROM. It beige-colored, says Outpost Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...When did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still watching the  screens) You should've called a few times to  bug me about your job prospects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo? Who's got Skywire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary and Phil watch as the Skywire logo gets steadily str on Gary's TV's. Phil is confounded:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Milo didn't launch Skywire, who  did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a low steady hum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CABLE plugged into a dusty wall-port that doesn't even  have a plate on it. Panning along the cable, we widen to  show:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In dim construction light, not far from the Sears generat Len sits on the concrete floor. The second data tower is  patched into a laptop. The distinct silver jewelcase lies the CD-rom drive. Shrot paces:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what are we doing? I don't get  any of this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I launched Skywire. Just pray the  last set of coordinates Milo sent me  connected us to Gary's satellite.

dialogues.speaker: FOUR TV SETS
dialogues.text: Each shows the standard Outpost desktop: Outpost logo, fo colors. [This is the all-purpose interface Lisa created f to Milo.] A window at the top shows a succession of Obitu with photos Lisa has downloaded from newspapers: "Program Dies in Highway Crash;" "Programmer Among Cult Suicides;" "Programmer Victim of Racial Killing," etc.) The obituari eight of them -- fade up and down in a continuous cycle.  Meantime: Lower on the screen, the material from the day-care data  tower appears, following the same succession we saw when  Milo brought up Teddy's data, i.e., footage of a young  Programmer at college, surveillance footage of him typing away (from behind), medical records that describe his  vulnerability or a crime primer that describes his scenar Between the obits and the primers, cause and effect is  (eventually) established. The crowning note is the audio, Gary in VOICE OVER, glean (by Lisa) from the audio version of his own book:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of us who write software achieve  our greatest work before age 30. As  I grow older I know how important it  is to access fertile young minds!

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE ON
dialogues.text: Gary watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear sirens grow near. Gunther watches the broadcast,  still gripping his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Gunther) You know the scenario for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sounds ominous. Lisa wonders what it means. Milo won what it means. He swallows hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Last thing you wanna do is hurt us  now. (not at all sure) Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Brian) Who's seeing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with dread) Who isn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1. MOVE PAST ROWS & ROWS OF PC's playing surveillance a crash-scene upload, and an obituary, in a college compu lab. Students watch, agog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We work hard to stay ahead because  we know any kid working in his garage  can put us out of business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2. TIMES SQUARE - Pedestrians and motorists (with craned  necks) watch the Jumbo-Tron, now the world's biggest desk In one window, college video of a promising Programmer, i the other, footage of a cult suicide. (Sometimes the  Programmer in question is simultaneous with his obit,  sometimes not, but the connection by now becomes clear).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first rule of the software  business is: those who don't innovate  are doomed to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3. The cuts accelerate. In a NETWORK CONTROL ROOM, Techni flip switches, trying to bring back scheduled programming At the NIKKEI, the Brokers are transfixed by what comes o the Big Board. In a VEGAS CASINO Gamblers sip their drink as they watch it on closed-circuit horserace monitors. On STREET CORNER, a Crack Dealer watches on his beeper. At a STADIUM, the Stones play but (tilting up) the Diamond Vis behind them plays Milo's broadcast. In an ELECTRONICS STO a wall of TV's -- 200 of them -- plays grisly primer foot for Shoppers. A guy takes a shiny wrapped copy of Outpost '98 from his basket, returns it to the shelf... In the Da Care Computer Room, it plays on all the monitors as Randy moves through the room with a big buzzing electro-magneti hoop, which he runs over each tower, wiping out data. Through all the cuts, we hear Gary's narration:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we work so hard to invent  or acquire great new applications.  Consumers don't care where new ideas  come from, just so long as they're  offered at competitive prices. Isn't  that what the free market's about?  Sure, we like being #1, but it's  pressure, too. This business is  binary: you're a zero or a one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of Government Lawyers, working late (Chinese take loosened ties) watch with a dawning sense of unbelievable good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Guess we should wake the Attorney  General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON: A PC SCREEN - Teddy Chin's recruitment file is one window, the hate crime footage is in another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been called "aggressive" but to  me, that's really a compliment.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: Larry watches with his start-up partners. His eyes close: hurts to see Teddy, again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at all the jobs and technologies  my "aggression" has created.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPEN on a framed photo of Barton, his Wife and Kids. The  broadcast plays, OS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lyle? Phone for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She comes in. No Barton. The front door is wide open, the is still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really are a family here at  Outpost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. MILO & LISA'S HOUSE - BEDROOM - NIGHT Paintings are gone from the wall, clothes flung around. M in on a note pinned to the pillow, as the TV plays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's why outsiders sometimes  sees us as "cultish" or "secretive." Milo, It wasn't so bad, really. XX "Alice"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High wide shot: sirens scream as unmarked sedans and squa squeal into the sanctified parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is loyalty and group spirit somehow  "sinister" nowadays?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open on Gary's TV monitors, then pan into the room. Phil departed; the Outpost Lawyers have taken his place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "murder" stuff is all innuendo:  bad PR, legally null. 'Could probably  be spun as Urban Legend. There is a  case for corporate espionage, but if  you cop a plea, you'll get a slap --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop a plea? I'm confused, Ted. You  think I knew about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Lawyers suppress their opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running the company, fighting  the DOJ, raising a family. Randy and  Phil obviously overreacted. To this  endless, antitrust witchhunt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (get real) The government's gonna offer 'em a  helluva deal to tie you into this.  Whether you knew about it or not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Randy, Phil and whoever else knew  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunther & Riman turn off a rural road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for PR, Skywire'll take care of  all that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...onto a tarmac. A private jet sits lit up, waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The world's seen it now. They know  it's gonna dominate the convergence  market even beyond how Outpost '98  dominates the desktop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Continuous dolly past: Gunther, as he takes a Chivas from the Stewardess; Lyle Barton who slips on his headset; Ali sorting through video casettes; Randy & Phil, playing rummy; Brian, eating a hamburger. Meantime:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after us, you give foreign  competitors a shot at the platform  that'll hold sway for 30 years: you  threaten not just our chip and PC  partners like when you came after  the browser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You threaten TV networks, phone  companies, catalog outlets, publishing  houses, movie studios, travel agents,  airlines, stock brokerages -- you  sabotage the whole economy. Talk  about undermining innovation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's writing on a  legal pad) Easy to spin, old as the hills: What's  good for Outpost is good for America.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands the pad to Gary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo watches the screens, anxiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Bob. Load in the other disk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary is reading from the Lawyer's pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I had no knowledge of these  activities, but I have to ask myself  if the competitive environment I  encouraged in some small way  contributed --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gary looks up. The Lawyer nods soberly at the TV's. In one window, the Skywire code scrolls slowly past. In t other, it says: "Here's the code for the operating system that made this braodcast possible. Take it. Use it. Make new convergence technologies as free as the Web." Under the windows, these words scroll continuously: HUMAN KNOWLEDGE BELONGS TO THE WORLD. Watching, Gary knits his brow: he looks wounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the lab that began the montage, move past rows of Stud scribbling madly as the code unfolds, or saving it to the hard drives. Off-screen, a Student says, "Well, the genie's out of tha bottle."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Board ousted Gary Boyd as  Chairman, they're assisting the DOJ  in the breakup of Outpost into  divisions.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: The CYBER PUNDIT chats with LARRY KING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's gotta kill him, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outpost was his baby, sure. On the  other hand, we just learned Gary  Boyd owns the Skywire satellites.  Personally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outpost doesn't own em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Lindholm sits on a couch watching TV. MOVERS are  carrying out computer equipment all around him. He tries ignore them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conglomerates're lined up to finance  the launch of the remaining  satellites. They'll pay him a huge  premium to get on-line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd change with a criminal  indictment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no hard evidence he knew  about this. Anybody who could  implicate him seems to've vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there a stigma? Bankrolling  this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stigma? Larry! 60 billion buys you  some slack in this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the kid who wrote Skywire --  then gave it away? They're calling  him the digital Robin Hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo. Surprised he's not your guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better believe everybody's trying  to sign him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Larry (King) chuckles, Larry (Lindholm) looks up. Milo and Lisa wear backpacks. As Milo sluffs his off:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry, Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry switches off the TV as he comes to his feet. A Move passes by, hauling out a monitor. Larry explains:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your app kind of blew mine out of  the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he shrugs) We'll come up with the next big thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...You wanna work -- here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got out of my other commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry hugs Milo. Turns to Lisa:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs Lisa, too. A Mover grabs Milo's backpack from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, wait! (when the Mover looks) Not giving everything away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mover sets it down, moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. Bring your stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Milo grabs up his pack, the three of them head away from  camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys'll be using Teddy's old  space, is that okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.
